frame.name: Capability
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> meets the pre-conditions for participating in an <fen>Event</fen>. A <fen>Degree</fen> modifier may be included to indicate by how much the <fen>Entity</fen> exceeds or falls short of the minimum requirements.
<ex>Conductor software gives <fex name="Entity">us</fex> the hands-on <t>capability</t> <fex name="Evt">to provide updates immediately</fex></ex>
<ex>The GOP is afraid that <fex name="Ent">it</fex> might not <m>be</m> <t>capable</t> <fex name="Evt">of keeping the seat vacated by Dunn.</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Ent">NASA</fex> <m>is</m> <t>unable</t> <fex name="Evt">to communicate with Mars rover</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Ent">He</fex> <t>can</t> <fex name="Evt">fly a kite</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> whose meeting or falling short of pre-conditions is assessed.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Little Tommy</fex> <t>ca</t> n't read</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> that the <fen>Entity</fen> may participate in.
<ex>White House voices doubts about Aristide's <t>ability</t> <fex name="Evt">to govern</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Entity</fen> exceeds or falls short of the minimum requirements for participating in the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Blind parents are <fex name="Deg">very</fex> <t>capable</t> of raising children</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the <fen>Entity</fen> meets or fails to meet the pre-conditions.
<ex><fex name="Circumstances">In this weather</fex>, an experienced pilot can still manage to fly 500 miles.</ex>
<ex>The new car has a cruising <t>capacity</t> <fex name="Circumstances">in excess of 150 kph</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity, event, or state that causes the <fen>Entity</fen> to be meet or fail to meet the pre-conditions for participating in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>They were not <t>able</t> to go outside <fex name="Explanation">because of the rain</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relevant_feature
FE.definition:
<def-root>The characteristic or behavior of the <fen>Entity</fen> that is considered when judging whether the <fen>Entity</fen> might participate in the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>These computers have the <fex name="rel">processing</fex> <t>capacity</t> to compute the precise date of the end of the world.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Status
FE.definition:
<def-root>The status of the capability.
<ex>This machine has many <fex name="Status">new</fex> <t>capabilities</t>.</ex>
<ex>He has an <fex name="Status">innate</fex> <t>potential</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root>The particular role that the <fen>Entity</fen> plays in the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>His <t>ability</t> <fex name="rol">as a leader</fex> to get things done is unparalleled.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> is capable of the <fen>Event</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE expresses how often the <fen>Entity</fen> is able to do the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Hong Kong's stores are <fex name="Freq">usually</fex> <t>able</t> to arrange shipment.</ex></def-root>
